Uses of Class
edu.ucsd.ccdb.ontomorph2.util.OMTVector

Packages that use OMTVector
edu.ucsd.ccdb.ontomorph2.core.spatial Provides multiple overlapping coordinate systems and wrappers around jME vectors. 
edu.ucsd.ccdb.ontomorph2.core.tangible Provides models of objects that can be rendered in the visual scene. 
edu.ucsd.ccdb.ontomorph2.core.tangible.neuronmorphology   
edu.ucsd.ccdb.ontomorph2.util Classes that provide basic functionality useful to classes in many different packages.

 OMTVector Tangible.getWorldNormal()
          Returns a vector representing the normal of the XY plane of the parent tangible Takes the cross of the X and Y and then rotates it about the CoordinateSystem of the source Tangible The vector returned is in Absoltue World Coordinates

Methods in edu.ucsd.ccdb.ontomorph2.util with parameters of type OMTVector
static boolean OMTUtility.isLookingFromAbove(OMTVector pointingAt, OMTVector normalToPlane)
          Tells whetehr or not the camera (or object) looking at a plane is 'above' the origin By calculating the angle between the vectors is such that the object is determined to be in positive Z-space if the angle > 90 and angle < 270; and in negative Z-space otherwise Z-space refers to the space of the plane
